tier_1_determinative.five_or_more_persons_committing_dacoity: Five to six persons obstructed a lorry by laying an iron pipe across the road and assaulted the lorry cleaner while committing a robbery.

tier_2_material.property_stolen: The lorry cleaner was robbed of Rs.700/-.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident occurred near Aatgaon on the Bombay to Agra National Highway between Vashind and Kasara.
tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The incident took place during the night intervening 29th August 1999 and 30th August 1999, at about 11 p.m.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Chima Sakru Wagh vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Ms. S. Suryawanshi, advocate appointed for the appellant.
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_respondent: Mr. A.M. Shringarpure, APP for the State.
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Sections 395, 397 r/w 34, and 353 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code Sections 395, 397 read with 34, and Section 353 read with 34.

residual_details.additional_facts: The appellant, Chima Sakru Wagh, was convicted and sentenced to nine years of rigorous imprisonment with a fine for offenses under IPC 395 and 397 r/w 34, and one year of rigorous imprisonment with a fine for IPC 353 r/w 34. The accused was in jail since 30th August 1999. The prosecution's case was supported by consistent testimonies from the police witnesses, and the appellant was caught on the spot during the robbery.
